docs.lead_paragraph: When Islamic State group militants invaded the Central Library of Mosul earlier this month, they were on a mission to destroy a familiar enemy: other people's ideas.

headline.main: Iraqi Libraries Ransacked by Islamic State Group in Mosul
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Libraries Ransacked by Islamic State Group in Mosul

docs.snippet: When Islamic State group militants invaded the Central Library of Mosul earlier this month, they were on a mission to destroy a familiar enemy: other people's ideas.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama announced a biomedical research initiative, including plans to collect data on one million Americans in order to tailor treatments to individual patients.

headline.main: U.S. to Collect Genetic Data to Hone Care
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Collect Genetic Data to Hone Care

docs.abstract: Pres Obama announces $215 million biomedical research initiative that aims at discovering genetic causes of disease and developing new drugs tailored to characteristics of individual patients.
docs.snippet: President Obama announced a biomedical research initiative, including plans to collect data on one million Americans in order to tailor treatments to individual patients.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gene research is getting a boost on both sides of the Atlantic, with scientists in England set to launch a project on Feb. 2 to analyze 100,000 entire human genomes and U.S. President Barack Obama backing a big new DNA data drive.

headline.main: UK to Launch 100,000 Genomes Project as Obama Backs DNA Drive
headline.print_headline: UK to Launch 100,000 Genomes Project as Obama Backs DNA Drive

docs.snippet: Gene research is getting a boost on both sides of the Atlantic, with scientists in England set to launch a project on Feb. 2 to analyze 100,000 entire human genomes and U.S. President Barack Obama backing a big new DNA data drive.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States has proposed analyzing genetic information from more than 1 million American volunteers as part of a new initiative to understand human disease and develop medicines targeted to an individual's genetic make-up.

headline.main: U.S. Proposes Effort to Analyze DNA From 1 Million People
headline.print_headline: U.S. Proposes Effort to Analyze DNA From 1 Million People

docs.snippet: The United States has proposed analyzing genetic information from more than 1 million American volunteers as part of a new initiative to understand human disease and develop medicines targeted to an individual's genetic make-up.

docs.lead_paragraph: Holding out the promise of major medical breakthroughs, President Barack Obama on Friday called on Congress to approve spending in medical research that tailors treatment to an individual's genes.

headline.main: Obama Calls on Congress to Fund 'Precision Medicine' Studies
headline.print_headline: Obama Calls on Congress to Fund 'Precision Medicine' Studies

docs.snippet: Holding out the promise of major medical breakthroughs, President Barack Obama on Friday called on Congress to approve spending in medical research that tailors treatment to an individual's genes.

headline.main: Are Vitamin Drinks a Bad Idea?

docs.abstract: Some nutrition scientists are concerned that with the profusion of fortified foods, beverages and supplements, many people may be ingesting levels of vitamins and other nutrients that are not only unnecessary, but potentially harmful.
docs.snippet: Some nutrition scientists are concerned that with the profusion of fortified foods, beverages and supplements, many people may be ingesting levels of vitamins and other nutrients that are not only unnecessary, but potentially harmful.
